name: Hilton Brussels City

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of my holiday.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: Check in was good, staff were efficient and friendly, my room was good and the bathroom clean.
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.text: I like where the hotel was located - the area was good, close to shops and walking distance to the Grote Place and restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good hotel!

reviews.text: I had some issues with the lights in my room being broken - which I feel housekeeping should have picked up - having said that though as soon as I mentioned it to staff downstairs they had someone come up and repair them.
reviews.title: "Perfectly looked after"
Perfect for a City break
reviews.text: I like that the hotel put on a "cocktail hour" to meet and greet other hotel guests - it was a great initiative and whilst I was hesitant at first to attend, I am glad that I did.

reviews.title: Nice room... poor service
reviews.text: I am a Hilton honors diamond member and found this hotel nice but with poor service. They were 35 mins late for my wake up call and did not apologize. I found the location adequate but a little out of the way. My room was a large... especially by European standards. It was clean and well equipped too. The lobby is OK and the hallways too. The reception staff was indifferent when it came to customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights using points, so we can't really complain TOO much. However, it was probably the worst Hilton I've ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Stayed at better Hiltons

reviews.text: The room wasn't very clean -- the floor was dirty and the bathroom had hairs in it (that wasn't ours) when we first arrived. Also, the drain in the shower/tub drained too slowly.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel LOVED IT

reviews.text: Because of the contemporary design of the hotel room, there was hardly any closet space and no shelves to place your clothes. Also, instead of a traditional shower curtain, there was a glass that only covered half of the tub so when you shower in the tub, water gets all over the bathroom floor!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros of the hotel: the bed was comfortable and is in a pretty good location. It's right next to a metro stop and close to a train station (Gare Nord), which was convenient to us since we took side trips (to Brugges and Antwerp) the 2 days we were there.
reviews.title: Total Bargain

reviews.text: Hotel wasn't quite what we were expecting with the large Sheraton property on one side and the "much smaller" Hilton property to the other.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Check in was efficient and pointed out that the incorrect frequent flyer card number had been recorded. Needless to say this was to be corrected in the system.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.text: Room was a deluxe room with wooden floors and a spacious bathroom. Good airconditioning and good sized bed. Room was clean and functional. Internet was free for Gold and Diamond cardholders which was an added bonus.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but needs to Vamp up

reviews.text: Breakfast, we were warned about was for regular guests in the bar area as there was a very large group staying in the hotel and they would be using the restaurant. Breakfast was very good and service was attentive. Perhaps due to the nature of the temporary location of the breakfast, the table cloths were not being replaced between sittings and they were badly stained.
reviews.title: Hilton standards and nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition the bar furniture was badly stained too. The seats had rather unsightly seat covers, which added a very oldie-worldie feel to the modern bar's atmosphere.
reviews.title: OK hotel in good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is worn out and in need of renovation. The rooms are small, the beds are uncomfortable, the decor is depressing. The breakfast buffet has a wide variety of hot and cold choices. Eggs are made to order. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel restaurant serves tasty food and service was very good.
reviews.title: OK Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week on business during October. Unfortunately was as far away from our office as possible.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Hotel was good. Not great, rooms were very small and bathroom needed some extra attention (bath filled with water when showering).
reviews.title: City Tour Base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good bar, and good breakfast selection for the Buffet (although expensive at 30 Euro each). Within easy walking distance to the Grand Place, shops, restaurants and Metro.
reviews.title: Good base for exploring

reviews.text: Stayed here because it was free as a Hilton Diamond member and because it's close to the Nord Station where we were catching a bus the next morning. Have been to Brussles once before and stayed closer to the city center. The location of this hotel is probably not ideal for tourists and more suited for business travelers. Check in was smooth but we were not granted an upgrade which was a bit of a disappointment after the fabulous upgrade we received at the Hilton Milan. We did get the customary free drink tickets and complementary wi-fi. One thing I did not like about the lobby was there was not an elevator from the lobby directly. You need to walk your luggage up a few stairs which was somewhat inconvenient because I had heavy bags. Also, the front desk staff did not offer help with my bags. The room was on the Hilton Honors floor which required walking down another small flight of stairs with my heavy bags. The room was small but standard for Europe. The bathroom was huge which is not standard for Europe and a nice surprise. There was no luggage stand in the room and when I called to request one, I sensed that the front desk was bothered by my request. She said, isn't there one in the closet? The shower leaked horribly and got a
reviews.title: It's only average

reviews.text: ton of water all over the bathroom floor. The bed was comfortable but I found the noise
reviews.title: Caters to business people but charges outrageous fees for wi-fi

reviews.text: level to be somewhat high. Plenty of sounds from the hallway came through the door. the complementary breakfast was very nice and plentiful. This was probably the best part of the stay. We booked another night with them out of necessity and specifically requested an upgrade with the front desk, so we will see if we get it. If so, there might be an opportunity for the hotel to redeem itself. Overall, I would not stay here again unless it's free and there are no other Hilton properties to choose from.
reviews.title: Attractive hotel, attentive staff

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel as part of a package deal, not necessarily by choice. The hotel was clean and staff professional, but although not particularly friendly. The twin room was small but well appointed. Oddly the bathroom had an automatic light which turned on before you crossed the threshold. This meant in the middle of the night, the person closest to the loo would be blinded by the light if the other person used the toilet- this was extremely annoying. Also annoying was the outrageous fees for internet use. I suppose since the hotel caters to business people, companies wouldn't balk at the cost, but if you are staying for pleasure, the cost is absurd. Breakfast was amazing!! Location was good as there is a metro station just a few hundred metres away and Gare de Nord is one metro stop away. Also across the street is the Brussels Grill which served a great beef stew. Nice hotel for the business traveller, but I want a more personal service.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way.

reviews.text: We stayed here for three days and found it to be attractive and stylish. The staff is expecially worth mentioning: I had forgotten my electric currency converter and they provided me with one free of charge; in addition, after one day in a single they provided us with a double, no problem and no charge. The free breakfast is superior and the spa very up-to-date. All in all I would give this hotel an excellent recommendation. The only drawback is the location near the Gare du Nord, but if you can overlook that I think you'll find this hotel well worth checking out.
reviews.title: Large rooms, difficult parking, central location

reviews.text: I stayed here on a business trip, arrived very late (around 1am) due to a problem with Eurostar which resulted in my train being really delayed. The reception staff were fine. The room was really small, which doesn't bother me as much as it might bother some others. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom (shower, no bath) was clean and had some nice toiletries in it . The room itself was quite tired and the flooring was extremely tatty,
reviews.title: Okay if you can get a good price - but outrageous wifi charges

reviews.text: As usual with Hiltons, the charge for wifi was usurious at €20 - totally outrageous, so you need to bear that in mind when deciding if your deal is as good as you think. The wardrobe was minute and if Id been staying for more than one night, would have had problems finding enough room for my clothes, but for one night it was fine.
reviews.title: Very nice and well-located hotel - but check your bill!

reviews.text: Although they claim to have 24 hour room service, I could find no sign of that in the room service menu where I could only find menus served up to 11pm.
reviews.title: "Boutiquey" and attractive lobby, smaller rooms.

reviews.text: I was in room 427 which was right at the back of the hotel which overlooked the main railway line into Brussels and once the trains started up in the morning, made sleep quite difficult, so I would suggest that you ask for a room at the front of the hotel if this would be a problem for you.
reviews.title: Not bad ... Not good

reviews.text: Overall, as other people have said this isnt up to the standard of other Hiltons Ive stayed in and I probably wouldn't stay here again. The unavailability of room service after 11pm is unacceptable and even in Brussels with its notoriously expensive hotels, you can get a much better deal in other hotels, (and get free wifi). I didnt have breakfast there as I had an early meeting, so cant comment on the standards there.
reviews.title: Well past due for some serious renovations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price we paid this hotel was OK but if you are looking to take a special someone away for a romantic weekend, this isnt the hotel for you. When we arrived it took us 20 minutes to check in and when we finally got to our room it was absolutely tiny. There was no bath in the bathroom and the bed was wedged against the wall. However, when we asked to be moved they moved us to a nicer room with a bath. Shame none of the electrics worked in the room! The hotel is cited about 10 minutes from the grand place (which is REALLY expensive- a beer is about 8 euros compared to about 3 in the side streets but worth it for the ambience) and near to the main shopping streets ( all shops are closed on Sundays ) but we found that there really wasnt that much to do. If we went again we would probably go to Bruge which has much more to do and is a lot cleaner.
reviews.title: Stay here if you dont mind living in a building site with box rooms

likes.liked: — Chcolate eggs at the front desk!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel during a week-end in February and had a very bad experience.
reviews.title: Not hilton standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is quite nice for business and shopping but a little bit far (15 minutes walking) from the main tourist area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at around 11 pm and had a terrible check-in that took us approximately 10 minutes. The room was tiny and the wardrobe was so small that only 2-3 shirts would fit in. We asked for a nice room and all we got was one with a view to a interior wall.
reviews.title: modern, City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The morning shift front desk staff was very helpful and changed us to a nicer room in the second day. I would definitely not come back to this hotel with so nice hotels in Brussels.
reviews.title: good place

likes.disliked: — 35 euro cent per min. for internet access (ridiculous)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Brussels City Hilton is an average hotel in an average neighborhood. We arrived later in the afternoon on a Saturday and were given a room on the Hilton Honours floor. The room was small but clean, which we come to expect from most European hotels.
reviews.title: Average hotel, but has ice machines!

likes.liked: — Ice machines and lots of hot water - in addition to the location.
likes.disliked: — shower had a 1/2 shield and not a curtain - kind of weird.

reviews.text: The room we were in had "hardwood" floors which were your typical laminate flooring, and the bathroom had tile. The hotel itself is located very close to the North Train Station as well as the metro. This was a great opportunity to get out and explore when we had a metro pass.
reviews.title: Convenience at a Price
Very Disappointing
reviews.text: There is also a mall with a grocery store located directly across the street so we would grab a few things there as we didn't spend the money on the breakfast. Did I mention there was ice? yay!

We stayed here due to my partner attending an event at the hotel. We arrived a day later than expected due to missing our connecting flight to Brussels. Though my partner did ring and explain the situation there seemed problems checking us into our room (even though the room had been paid for in advance).
reviews.title: Great location, service disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eventually we were given the 'keys' to our room. My partner disappeared off to his engagement and I was left to go up to the room alone. The room was a huge disappointment. Very small and pokey. The beds were 2 single beds stuck together. The bathroom was tiny and the because the room was at an angle the toilet was wedged next to the bath. My partner is a big man, 6'3 and unless he jumped over the toilet whilst doing some kind of ballet flip he would not have been able to get into the bath for his shower. I went down to reception and complained about the beds and the bathroom. After some pursuading (on my part) that this was not acceptable I was moved to another room.
reviews.title: Loved Hilton Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located next to Rogier Metro stop and is situated across the road from the main shopping street. The staff are pleasant and the common areas are quite nice. Well equipped gym and sauna. The hotel room was tiny and the bathroom was very, very small. WiFi is provided at about 25 Euros for 24 hours, which is ridiculous in 2011. There are guest computers provided, however, you must still purchase internet access. The breakfast is not bad but we had to request staff to fill up things like tea bags, milk and bread.
reviews.title: Great location, tiny room and shoebox-sized bathroom

reviews.text: I stayed here late last year, whilst on a week-long tour law related trip. During my trip travelling around many EU Countries, I stayed in many hotel much better (and cheaper!) than this.
reviews.title: In my opinion, did not live up to expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps it was just a little disappointing as you expect a Hilton to be stellar.
reviews.title: business not pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As there was a large group of us booking in at the same type, check-in was handled efficiently and politely.
reviews.title: Pretty good all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The décor of the hotel was of course, beautiful.
reviews.title: A great hotel in Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for two nights in August of 2007. We had never been to Brussels before, so we don't have anything to compare it to, but I can describe generally our experience.
reviews.title: Great Room; Good Location

likes.disliked: — No view out of room window

reviews.text: The hotel is literally on top of a subway station, which was perfect for travel to/from the main train station (not so convenient to travel to the center of the city on the particular line). The check-in process was painless and we were allowed to check in very early (10AM). Most of the employees spoke very good English and were generally helpful. The room was quite large (based on continental Europe standards) and appeared to be newly renovated. The A/C worked well and the bathroom was perfect (except, of course, for the ubiquitous European half-sized shower door that makes showering difficult without flooding the bathroom floor). We did not spend much time in the hotel, so we didn't experience the restaurant/bar, but the hotel has an excellent gym (including sauna, steam room and solarium) and good business center (private computer rooms with printers). The hotel is near a couple of decent restaurants and a popular shopping street (Boulevard Adolphe Max).
reviews.title: Positive review for the Brussels City
Nice hotel, great for business travellers
reviews.text: Overall, it was a great hotel and the rates are very reasonable.

My daughter and I arrived via Eurostar at Brussels Midi and transfered to Brussels Noord on the same ticket. We stayed for 1 night as we were travelling to Luxembourg the following day. At Brussels Noord train station follow the signs to Place Rogier and when outside you will need to walk straight ahead for about 100 metres to the Hotel in the Place Rogier.
reviews.title: not Hilton standard

likes.liked: — it gave me somewhere to sleep for 8 hours or so
likes.disliked: — Everything else - mainly that I expect much better from a Hilton hotel

reviews.text: Check in was efficient, but there was no queue. The lobby area looked very 'new', I suspect this has had an update and it was very effective. Help was given with luggage up a few steps to the lifts. Our room was on the 8th floor. The bedroom was of a fairly good size, clean and neat. It also included tea and coffee making facilities which we didn't expect plus an iron and board. Usual internet, TV, with option to see you bill - which can be useful.
reviews.title: Good Hotel but beware of the small rooms

likes.liked: — Location and furniture in the rooms and Loby area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We too bagged ourselves a bargain through TravelZoo, travelling to Brussels for the weekend by Eurostar and a 3 night stay in the Hitol Hotel Brussels City.
reviews.title: A lovely first visit to Brussels.... we will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never travelled on the Eurostar before, we was impressed with the speed of 'checking in', basic lounge area, waiting times and train 'facilities'... its a pretty standard train that you are on for about 2 hours to get you from A to B... The Orient Express its not! :)
reviews.title: Don't let the name fool you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival at Brussels, we found the Metro and waiting 3 minutes for our next train.. that took aproximately 10 minutes to get to Rogier (which is situated just across the road from the Hilton).
reviews.title: Brussels Weekend Break

reviews.text: We both felt that the staff at the Hilton were fabulous, very welcoming, very helpful and gave us lots of maps, ideas on where to go, what to see and even marked them on our map! It was raining a little outside, so they also offered us an umberella.
reviews.title: A disgusting hotel worth avoiding at all costs.

reviews.text: Our room was on the 8th floor and was overlooking the park. It was a nice view but you can hear the traffic, at the end of the day you are in the centre of Brussels, so do expect some noise when the windows are open.
reviews.title: A long weekend in Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh I miss the other Hilton. Yes the rooms were dated, but they were large, staff was well trained, breakfast was nice. And oh that view!
reviews.title: Getting worse

reviews.text: I only ever came to this, former "City" Hilton when I had to catch an early train the next morning. Now I seriously consider other options in Brussels.
reviews.title: Nice business oriented hotel

reviews.text: This weekend, the Hilton was expensive for some reason so I didn't expect to end up in one of their shoeboxes. But I did.
reviews.title: A quiet haven in a bustling city

reviews.text: The Hilton did a very nice job renovating in a laid back, loungy style. The room renovations have been made maybe 10 years ago.
reviews.title: not good

reviews.text: Things look a bit boutique and nice, until you enter your room and realize they gave you one of the 16 m2 rooms. I believe that's 16 m2 including the bath.
reviews.title: Good but a little faded

description: Highlights•Situated in the heart of Brussels near the Rue Neuve shopping district•A few minutes’ walk from Brussels Gare du Nord station•Close to World Trade Center and popular attractions including Grand Place City Square•Wireless internet access, business center and Scandinavian Wellness and Health Club •Bien Belge Living Lounge restaurant and bar serving Belgian specialties, fine wine and beerSituated in the center of downtown Brussels, within yards of Gare du Nord station and in close proximity to the Rue Neuve shopping district and the World Trade Center, the Hilton Brussels City hotel is the ideal place to stay when you are visiting Belgium’s capital. All the facilities are in place to allow you to remain productive during your stay. With wireless internet access, a business center and a range of meeting rooms you will be able to work with the minimum of hassle.After a busy day in Brussels or a long journey, you can relax and rejuvenate in the Scandinavian Wellness and Health Club and sample the delicious Flemish cuisine on offer in the Bien Belge Living Lounge restaurant and bar. Offering responsive service and stylish contemporary comfort in an enviable location, this Brussels hotel has everything you need to make the most of your stay in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities.Local Attractions •Stroll to Brussels’ famous Grand Place, the center of the Old City’s pavement café culture•Stop in at Marcolini’s Chocolatiers and buy some handmade Belgian chocolates to take home•Experience world class shops located on the Rue Neuve •Visit the Delerium Café•View one of the world’s finest collections of pre-modern art at the Musée d’Art Ancien
